164static map<string, sai_port_interface_type_t> interface_type_map_for_an =
165{
166 { "none", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_NONE },
167 { "cr", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_CR },
168 { "cr2", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_CR2 },
169 { "cr4", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_CR4 },
170 { "cr8", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_CR8 },
171 { "sr", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_SR },
172 { "sr2", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_SR2 },
173 { "sr4", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_SR4 },
174 { "sr8", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_SR8 },
175 { "lr", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_LR },
176 { "lr4", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_LR4 },
177 { "lr8", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_LR8 },
178 { "kr", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_KR },
179 { "kr4", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_KR4 },
180 { "kr8", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_KR8 },
181 { "caui", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_CAUI },
182 { "gmii", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_GMII },
183 { "sfi", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_SFI },
184 { "xlaui", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_XLAUI },
185 { "kr2", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_KR2 },
186 { "caui4", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_CAUI4 },
187 { "xaui", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_XAUI },
188 { "xfi", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_XFI },
189 { "xgmii", SAI_PORT_INTERFACE_TYPE_XGMII }
190};
191
192static const std::string& getValidInterfaceTypes()
193{
194 static std::string validInterfaceTypes;
195 if (validInterfaceTypes.empty())
196 {
197 std::ostringstream oss;
198 for (auto &iter : interface_type_map_for_an)
199 {
200 oss << iter.first << " ";
201 }
202 validInterfaceTypes = oss.str();
203 boost::to_upper(validInterfaceTypes);
204 }
205
206 return validInterfaceTypes;
207}

330static char* hostif_vlan_tag[] = {
331 [SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_STRIP] = "SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_STRIP",
332 [SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_KEEP] = "SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_KEEP",
333 [SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_ORIGINAL] = "SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_ORIGINAL"
334};
335
336static bool isValidPortTypeForLagMember(const Port& port)
337{
338 return (port.m_type == Port::Type::PHY || port.m_type == Port::Type::SYSTEM);
339}
340
341/*
342 * Initialize PortsOrch
343 * 0) If Gearbox is enabled, then initialize the external PHYs as defined in
344 * the GEARBOX_TABLE.
345 * 1) By default, a switch has one CPU port, one 802.1Q bridge, and one default
346 * VLAN. All ports are in .1Q bridge as bridge ports, and all bridge ports
347 * are in default VLAN as VLAN members.
348 * 2) Query switch CPU port.
349 * 3) Query ports associated with lane mappings
350 * 4) Query switch .1Q bridge and all its bridge ports.
351 * 5) Query switch default VLAN and all its VLAN members.
352 * 6) Remove each VLAN member from default VLAN and each bridge port from .1Q
353 * bridge. By design, SONiC switch starts with all bridge ports removed from
354 * default VLAN and all ports removed from .1Q bridge.
355 */
356PortsOrch::PortsOrch(DBConnector *db, DBConnector *stateDb, vector<table_name_with_pri_t> &tableNames, DBConnector *chassisAppDb) :
357 Orch(db, tableNames),
358 m_portStateTable(stateDb, STATE_PORT_TABLE_NAME),
359 port_stat_manager(PORT_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP, StatsMode::READ, PORT_STAT_FLEX_COUNTER_POLLING_INTERVAL_MS, false),
360 gb_port_stat_manager("GB_FLEX_COUNTER_DB",
361 PORT_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP, StatsMode::READ,
362 PORT_STAT_FLEX_COUNTER_POLLING_INTERVAL_MS, false),
363 port_buffer_drop_stat_manager(PORT_BUFFER_DROP_STAT_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP, StatsMode::READ, PORT_BUFFER_DROP_STAT_POLLING_INTERVAL_MS, false),
364 queue_stat_manager(QUEUE_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP, StatsMode::READ, QUEUE_STAT_FLEX_COUNTER_POLLING_INTERVAL_MS, false),
365 m_port_state_poller(new SelectableTimer(timespec { .tv_sec = PORT_STATE_POLLING_SEC, .tv_nsec = 0 }))
366{
367 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
368
369 /* Initialize counter table */
370 m_counter_db = shared_ptr<DBConnector>(new DBConnector("COUNTERS_DB", 0));
371 m_counterTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_PORT_NAME_MAP));
372 m_counterSysPortTable = unique_ptr<Table>(
373 new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_SYSTEM_PORT_NAME_MAP));
374 m_counterLagTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_LAG_NAME_MAP));
375 FieldValueTuple tuple("", "");
376 vector<FieldValueTuple> defaultLagFv;
377 defaultLagFv.push_back(tuple);
378 m_counterLagTable->set("", defaultLagFv);
379
380 /* Initialize port and vlan table */
381 m_portTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(db, APP_PORT_TABLE_NAME));
382
383 /* Initialize gearbox */
384 m_gearboxTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(db, "_GEARBOX_TABLE"));
385
386 /* Initialize queue tables */
387 m_queueTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_QUEUE_NAME_MAP));
388 m_voqTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_VOQ_NAME_MAP));
389 m_queuePortTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_QUEUE_PORT_MAP));
390 m_queueIndexTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_QUEUE_INDEX_MAP));
391 m_queueTypeTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_QUEUE_TYPE_MAP));
392
393 /* Initialize ingress priority group tables */
394 m_pgTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_PG_NAME_MAP));
395 m_pgPortTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_PG_PORT_MAP));
396 m_pgIndexTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_counter_db.get(), COUNTERS_PG_INDEX_MAP));
397
398 m_flex_db = shared_ptr<DBConnector>(new DBConnector("FLEX_COUNTER_DB", 0));
399 m_flexCounterTable = unique_ptr<ProducerTable>(new ProducerTable(m_flex_db.get(), FLEX_COUNTER_TABLE));
400 m_flexCounterGroupTable = unique_ptr<ProducerTable>(new ProducerTable(m_flex_db.get(), FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP_TABLE));
401
402 m_state_db = shared_ptr<DBConnector>(new DBConnector("STATE_DB", 0));
403 m_stateBufferMaximumValueTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(m_state_db.get(), STATE_BUFFER_MAXIMUM_VALUE_TABLE));
404
405 initGearbox();
406
407 string queueWmSha, pgWmSha;
408 string queueWmPluginName = "watermark_queue.lua";
409 string pgWmPluginName = "watermark_pg.lua";
410 string portRatePluginName = "port_rates.lua";
411
412 try
413 {
414 string queueLuaScript = swss::loadLuaScript(queueWmPluginName);
415 queueWmSha = swss::loadRedisScript(m_counter_db.get(), queueLuaScript);
416
417 string pgLuaScript = swss::loadLuaScript(pgWmPluginName);
418 pgWmSha = swss::loadRedisScript(m_counter_db.get(), pgLuaScript);
419
420 string portRateLuaScript = swss::loadLuaScript(portRatePluginName);
421 string portRateSha = swss::loadRedisScript(m_counter_db.get(), portRateLuaScript);
422
423 vector<FieldValueTuple> fieldValues;
424 fieldValues.emplace_back(QUEUE_PLUGIN_FIELD, queueWmSha);
425 fieldValues.emplace_back(POLL_INTERVAL_FIELD, QUEUE_WATERMARK_FLEX_STAT_COUNTER_POLL_MSECS);
426 fieldValues.emplace_back(STATS_MODE_FIELD, STATS_MODE_READ_AND_CLEAR);
427 m_flexCounterGroupTable->set(QUEUE_WATERMARK_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP, fieldValues);
428
429 fieldValues.clear();
430 fieldValues.emplace_back(PG_PLUGIN_FIELD, pgWmSha);
431 fieldValues.emplace_back(POLL_INTERVAL_FIELD, PG_WATERMARK_FLEX_STAT_COUNTER_POLL_MSECS);
432 fieldValues.emplace_back(STATS_MODE_FIELD, STATS_MODE_READ_AND_CLEAR);
433 m_flexCounterGroupTable->set(PG_WATERMARK_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP, fieldValues);
434
435 fieldValues.clear();
436 fieldValues.emplace_back(PORT_PLUGIN_FIELD, portRateSha);
437 fieldValues.emplace_back(POLL_INTERVAL_FIELD, PORT_RATE_FLEX_COUNTER_POLLING_INTERVAL_MS);
438 fieldValues.emplace_back(STATS_MODE_FIELD, STATS_MODE_READ);
439 m_flexCounterGroupTable->set(PORT_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP, fieldValues);
440
441 fieldValues.clear();
442 fieldValues.emplace_back(POLL_INTERVAL_FIELD, PG_DROP_FLEX_STAT_COUNTER_POLL_MSECS);
443 fieldValues.emplace_back(STATS_MODE_FIELD, STATS_MODE_READ);
444 m_flexCounterGroupTable->set(PG_DROP_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP, fieldValues);
445 }
446 catch (const runtime_error &e)
447 {
448 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Port flex counter groups were not set successfully: %s", e.what());
449 }
450
451 uint32_t i, j;
452 sai_status_t status;
453 sai_attribute_t attr;
454
455 /* Get CPU port */
456 attr.id = SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_CPU_PORT;
457
458 status = sai_switch_api->get_switch_attribute(gSwitchId, 1, &attr);
459 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
460 {
461 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get CPU port, rv:%d", status);
462 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_SWITCH, status);
463 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
464 {
465 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
466 }
467 }
468
469 m_cpuPort = Port("CPU", Port::CPU);
470 m_cpuPort.m_port_id = attr.value.oid;
471 m_portList[m_cpuPort.m_alias] = m_cpuPort;
472 m_port_ref_count[m_cpuPort.m_alias] = 0;
473
474 /* Get port number */
475 attr.id = SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_PORT_NUMBER;
476
477 status = sai_switch_api->get_switch_attribute(gSwitchId, 1, &attr);
478 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
479 {
480 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get port number, rv:%d", status);
481 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_SWITCH, status);
482 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
483 {
484 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
485 }
486 }
487
488 m_portCount = attr.value.u32;
489 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Get %d ports", m_portCount);
490
491 /* Get port list */
492 vector<sai_object_id_t> port_list;
493 port_list.resize(m_portCount);
494
495 attr.id = SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_PORT_LIST;
496 attr.value.objlist.count = (uint32_t)port_list.size();
497 attr.value.objlist.list = port_list.data();
498
499 status = sai_switch_api->get_switch_attribute(gSwitchId, 1, &attr);
500 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
501 {
502 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get port list, rv:%d", status);
503 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_SWITCH, status);
504 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
505 {
506 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
507 }
508 }
509
510 /* Get port hardware lane info */
511 for (i = 0; i < m_portCount; i++)
512 {
513 sai_uint32_t lanes[8] = { 0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0 };
514 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_HW_LANE_LIST;
515 attr.value.u32list.count = 8;
516 attr.value.u32list.list = lanes;
517
518 status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(port_list[i], 1, &attr);
519 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
520 {
521 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get hardware lane list pid:%" PRIx64, port_list[i]);
522 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
523 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
524 {
525 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
526 }
527 }
528
529 set<int> tmp_lane_set;
530 for (j = 0; j < attr.value.u32list.count; j++)
531 {
532 tmp_lane_set.insert(attr.value.u32list.list[j]);
533 }
534
535 string tmp_lane_str = "";
536 for (auto s : tmp_lane_set)
537 {
538 tmp_lane_str += to_string(s) + " ";
539 }
540 tmp_lane_str = tmp_lane_str.substr(0, tmp_lane_str.size()-1);
541
542 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Get port with lanes pid:%" PRIx64 " lanes:%s", port_list[i], tmp_lane_str.c_str());
543 m_portListLaneMap[tmp_lane_set] = port_list[i];
544 }
545
546 /* Get the flood control types and check if combined mode is supported */
547 vector<int32_t> supported_flood_control_types(max_flood_control_types, 0);
548 sai_s32_list_t values;
549 values.count = max_flood_control_types;
550 values.list = supported_flood_control_types.data();
551
552 if (sai_query_attribute_enum_values_capability(gSwitchId, SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_VLAN,
553 SAI_VLAN_ATTR_UNKNOWN_UNICAST_FLOOD_CONTROL_TYPE,
554 &values) != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
555 {
556 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("This device does not support unknown unicast flood control types");
557 }
558 else
559 {
560 for (uint32_t idx = 0; idx < values.count; idx++)
561 {
562 uuc_sup_flood_control_type.insert(static_cast<sai_vlan_flood_control_type_t>(values.list[idx]));
563 }
564 }
565
566
567 supported_flood_control_types.assign(max_flood_control_types, 0);
568 values.count = max_flood_control_types;
569 values.list = supported_flood_control_types.data();
570
571 if (sai_query_attribute_enum_values_capability(gSwitchId, SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_VLAN,
572 SAI_VLAN_ATTR_BROADCAST_FLOOD_CONTROL_TYPE,
573 &values) != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
574 {
575 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("This device does not support broadcast flood control types");
576 }
577 else
578 {
579 for (uint32_t idx = 0; idx < values.count; idx++)
580 {
581 bc_sup_flood_control_type.insert(static_cast<sai_vlan_flood_control_type_t>(values.list[idx]));
582 }
583 }
584
585 /* Get default 1Q bridge and default VLAN */
586 vector<sai_attribute_t> attrs;
587 attr.id = SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_DEFAULT_1Q_BRIDGE_ID;
588 attrs.push_back(attr);
589 attr.id = SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_DEFAULT_VLAN_ID;
590 attrs.push_back(attr);
591
592 status = sai_switch_api->get_switch_attribute(gSwitchId, (uint32_t)attrs.size(), attrs.data());
593 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
594 {
595 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get default 1Q bridge and/or default VLAN, rv:%d", status);
596 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_SWITCH, status);
597 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
598 {
599 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
600 }
601 }
602
603 m_default1QBridge = attrs[0].value.oid;
604 m_defaultVlan = attrs[1].value.oid;
605
606 /* Get System ports */
607 getSystemPorts();
608
609 removeDefaultVlanMembers();
610 removeDefaultBridgePorts();
611
612 /* Add port oper status notification support */
613 DBConnector *notificationsDb = new DBConnector("ASIC_DB", 0);
614 m_portStatusNotificationConsumer = new swss::NotificationConsumer(notificationsDb, "NOTIFICATIONS");
615 auto portStatusNotificatier = new Notifier(m_portStatusNotificationConsumer, this, "PORT_STATUS_NOTIFICATIONS");
616 Orch::addExecutor(portStatusNotificatier);
617
618 if (gMySwitchType == "voq")
619 {
620 string tableName;
621 //Add subscriber to process system LAG (System PortChannel) table
622 tableName = CHASSIS_APP_LAG_TABLE_NAME;
623 Orch::addExecutor(new Consumer(new SubscriberStateTable(chassisAppDb, tableName, TableConsumable::DEFAULT_POP_BATCH_SIZE, 0), this, tableName));
624 m_tableVoqSystemLagTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(chassisAppDb, CHASSIS_APP_LAG_TABLE_NAME));
625
626 //Add subscriber to process system LAG member (System PortChannelMember) table
627 tableName = CHASSIS_APP_LAG_MEMBER_TABLE_NAME;
628 Orch::addExecutor(new Consumer(new SubscriberStateTable(chassisAppDb, tableName, TableConsumable::DEFAULT_POP_BATCH_SIZE, 0), this, tableName));
629 m_tableVoqSystemLagMemberTable = unique_ptr<Table>(new Table(chassisAppDb, CHASSIS_APP_LAG_MEMBER_TABLE_NAME));
630
631 m_lagIdAllocator = unique_ptr<LagIdAllocator> (new LagIdAllocator(chassisAppDb));
632 }
633
634 auto executor = new ExecutableTimer(m_port_state_poller, this, "PORT_STATE_POLLER");
635 Orch::addExecutor(executor);
636}
637
638void PortsOrch::removeDefaultVlanMembers()
639{
640 /* Get VLAN members in default VLAN */
641 vector<sai_object_id_t> vlan_member_list(m_portCount + m_systemPortCount);
642
643 sai_attribute_t attr;
644 attr.id = SAI_VLAN_ATTR_MEMBER_LIST;
645 attr.value.objlist.count = (uint32_t)vlan_member_list.size();
646 attr.value.objlist.list = vlan_member_list.data();
647
648 sai_status_t status = sai_vlan_api->get_vlan_attribute(m_defaultVlan, 1, &attr);
649 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
650 {
651 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get VLAN member list in default VLAN, rv:%d", status);
652 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_VLAN, status);
653 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
654 {
655 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
656 }
657 }
658
659 /* Remove VLAN members in default VLAN */
660 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < attr.value.objlist.count; i++)
661 {
662 status = sai_vlan_api->remove_vlan_member(vlan_member_list[i]);
663 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
664 {
665 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to remove VLAN member, rv:%d", status);
666 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
667 }
668 }
669
670 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Remove %d VLAN members from default VLAN", attr.value.objlist.count);
671}
672
673void PortsOrch::removeDefaultBridgePorts()
674{
675 /* Get bridge ports in default 1Q bridge
676 * By default, there will be (m_portCount + m_systemPortCount) number of SAI_BRIDGE_PORT_TYPE_PORT
677 * ports and one SAI_BRIDGE_PORT_TYPE_1Q_ROUTER port. The former type of
678 * ports will be removed. */
679 vector<sai_object_id_t> bridge_port_list(m_portCount + m_systemPortCount + 1);
680
681 sai_attribute_t attr;
682 attr.id = SAI_BRIDGE_ATTR_PORT_LIST;
683 attr.value.objlist.count = (uint32_t)bridge_port_list.size();
684 attr.value.objlist.list = bridge_port_list.data();
685
686 sai_status_t status = sai_bridge_api->get_bridge_attribute(m_default1QBridge, 1, &attr);
687 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
688 {
689 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get bridge port list in default 1Q bridge, rv:%d", status);
690 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_BRIDGE, status);
691 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
692 {
693 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
694 }
695 }
696
697 auto bridge_port_count = attr.value.objlist.count;
698
699 /* Remove SAI_BRIDGE_PORT_TYPE_PORT bridge ports in default 1Q bridge */
700 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < bridge_port_count; i++)
701 {
702 attr.id = SAI_BRIDGE_PORT_ATTR_TYPE;
703 attr.value.s32 = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID;
704
705 status = sai_bridge_api->get_bridge_port_attribute(bridge_port_list[i], 1, &attr);
706 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
707 {
708 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get bridge port type, rv:%d", status);
709 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_BRIDGE, status);
710 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
711 {
712 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
713 }
714 }
715 if (attr.value.s32 == SAI_BRIDGE_PORT_TYPE_PORT)
716 {
717 status = sai_bridge_api->remove_bridge_port(bridge_port_list[i]);
718 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
719 {
720 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to remove bridge port, rv:%d", status);
721 throw runtime_error("PortsOrch initialization failure");
722 }
723 }
724 }
725
726 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Remove bridge ports from default 1Q bridge");
727}
728
729bool PortsOrch::allPortsReady()
730{
731 return m_initDone && m_pendingPortSet.empty();
732}
733
734/* Upon receiving PortInitDone, all the configured ports have been created in both hardware and kernel*/
735bool PortsOrch::isInitDone()
736{
737 return m_initDone;
738}
739
740// Upon m_portConfigState transiting to PORT_CONFIG_DONE state, all physical ports have been "created" in hardware.
741// Because of the asynchronous nature of sairedis calls, "create" in the strict sense means that the SAI create_port()
742// function is called and the create port event has been pushed to the sairedis pipeline. Because sairedis pipeline
743// preserves the order of the events received, any event that depends on the physical port being created first, e.g.,
744// buffer profile apply, will be popped in the FIFO fashion, processed in the right order after the physical port is
745// physically created in the ASIC, and thus can be issued safely when this function call returns true.
746bool PortsOrch::isConfigDone()
747{
748 return m_portConfigState == PORT_CONFIG_DONE;
749}
750
751bool PortsOrch::isGearboxEnabled()
752{
753 return m_gearboxEnabled;
754}
755
756/* Use this method to retrieve the desired port if the destination port is a Gearbox port.
757 * For example, if Gearbox is enabled on a specific physical interface,
758 * the destination port may be the PHY or LINE side of the external PHY.
759 * The original port id is returned if it's not a Gearbox configured port.
760 */
761bool PortsOrch::getDestPortId(sai_object_id_t src_port_id, dest_port_type_t port_type, sai_object_id_t &des_port_id)
762{
763 bool status = false;
764 des_port_id = src_port_id;
765
766 if (m_gearboxEnabled)
767 {
768 if (m_gearboxPortListLaneMap.find(src_port_id) != m_gearboxPortListLaneMap.end())
769 {
770 if (PHY_PORT_TYPE == port_type)
771 {
772 des_port_id = get<0>(m_gearboxPortListLaneMap[src_port_id]);
773 SWSS_LOG_DEBUG("BOX: port id:%" PRIx64 " has a phy-side port id:%" PRIx64, src_port_id, des_port_id);
774 status = true;
775 }
776 else if (LINE_PORT_TYPE == port_type)
777 {
778 des_port_id = get<1>(m_gearboxPortListLaneMap[src_port_id]);
779 SWSS_LOG_DEBUG("BOX: port id:%" PRIx64 " has a line-side port id:%" PRIx64, src_port_id, des_port_id);
780 status = true;
781 }
782 }
783 }
784
785 return status;
786}
787
788bool PortsOrch::isPortAdminUp(const string &alias)
789{
790 auto it = m_portList.find(alias);
791 if (it == m_portList.end())
792 {
793 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get Port object by port alias: %s", alias.c_str());
794 return false;
795 }
796
797 return it->second.m_admin_state_up;
798}
799
800map<string, Port>& PortsOrch::getAllPorts()
801{
802 return m_portList;
803}
804
805bool PortsOrch::getPort(string alias, Port &p)
806{
807 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
808
809 if (m_portList.find(alias) == m_portList.end())
810 {
811 return false;
812 }
813 else
814 {
815 p = m_portList[alias];
816 return true;
817 }
818}
819
820bool PortsOrch::getPort(sai_object_id_t id, Port &port)
821{
822 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
823
824 auto itr = saiOidToAlias.find(id);
825 if (itr == saiOidToAlias.end())
826 {
827 return false;
828 }
829 else
830 {
831 if (!getPort(itr->second, port))
832 {
833 SWSS_LOG_THROW("Inconsistent saiOidToAlias map and m_portList map: oid=%" PRIx64, id);
834 }
835 return true;
836 }
837
838 return false;
839}
840
841void PortsOrch::increasePortRefCount(const string &alias)
842{
843 assert (m_port_ref_count.find(alias) != m_port_ref_count.end());
844 m_port_ref_count[alias]++;
845}
846
847void PortsOrch::decreasePortRefCount(const string &alias)
848{
849 assert (m_port_ref_count.find(alias) != m_port_ref_count.end());
850 m_port_ref_count[alias]--;
851}
852
853void PortsOrch::increaseBridgePortRefCount(Port &port)
854{
855 assert (m_bridge_port_ref_count.find(port.m_alias) != m_bridge_port_ref_count.end());
856 m_bridge_port_ref_count[port.m_alias]++;
857}
858
859void PortsOrch::decreaseBridgePortRefCount(Port &port)
860{
861 assert (m_bridge_port_ref_count.find(port.m_alias) != m_bridge_port_ref_count.end());
862 m_bridge_port_ref_count[port.m_alias]--;
863}
864
865bool PortsOrch::getBridgePortReferenceCount(Port &port)
866{
867 assert (m_bridge_port_ref_count.find(port.m_alias) != m_bridge_port_ref_count.end());
868 return m_bridge_port_ref_count[port.m_alias];
869}
870
871bool PortsOrch::getPortByBridgePortId(sai_object_id_t bridge_port_id, Port &port)
872{
873 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
874
875 auto itr = saiOidToAlias.find(bridge_port_id);
876 if (itr == saiOidToAlias.end())
877 {
878 return false;
879 }
880 else
881 {
882 getPort(itr->second, port);
883 return true;
884 }
885
886 return false;
887}
888
889bool PortsOrch::addSubPort(Port &port, const string &alias, const string &vlan, const bool &adminUp, const uint32_t &mtu)
890{
891 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
892
893 size_t found = alias.find(VLAN_SUB_INTERFACE_SEPARATOR);
894 if (found == string::npos)
895 {
896 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("%s is not a sub interface", alias.c_str());
897 return false;
898 }
899 subIntf subIf(alias);
900 string parentAlias = subIf.parentIntf();
901 sai_vlan_id_t vlan_id;
902 try
903 {
904 vlan_id = static_cast<sai_vlan_id_t>(stoul(vlan));
905 }
906 catch (const std::invalid_argument &e)
907 {
908 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Invalid argument %s to %s()", vlan.c_str(), e.what());
909 return false;
910 }
911 catch (const std::out_of_range &e)
912 {
913 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Out of range argument %s to %s()", vlan.c_str(), e.what());
914 return false;
915 }
916 if (vlan_id > MAX_VALID_VLAN_ID)
917 {
918 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Sub interface %s Port object creation failed: invalid VLAN id %u", alias.c_str(), vlan_id);
919 return false;
920 }
921
922 auto it = m_portList.find(parentAlias);
923 if (it == m_portList.end())
924 {
925 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Sub interface %s Port object creation: parent port %s is not ready", alias.c_str(), parentAlias.c_str());
926 return false;
927 }
928 Port &parentPort = it->second;
929
930 Port p(alias, Port::SUBPORT);
931
932 p.m_admin_state_up = adminUp;
933
934 if (mtu)
935 {
936 p.m_mtu = mtu;
937 }
938 else
939 {
940 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Sub interface %s inherits mtu size %u from parent port %s", alias.c_str(), parentPort.m_mtu, parentAlias.c_str());
941 p.m_mtu = parentPort.m_mtu;
942 }
943
944 switch (parentPort.m_type)
945 {
946 case Port::PHY:
947 p.m_parent_port_id = parentPort.m_port_id;
948 break;
949 case Port::LAG:
950 p.m_parent_port_id = parentPort.m_lag_id;
951 break;
952 default:
953 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Sub interface %s Port object creation failed: \
954 parent port %s of invalid type (must be physical port or LAG)", alias.c_str(), parentAlias.c_str());
955 return false;
956 }
957 p.m_vlan_info.vlan_id = vlan_id;
958
959 // Change hostif vlan tag for the parent port only when a first subport is created
960 if (parentPort.m_child_ports.empty())
961 {
962 if (!setHostIntfsStripTag(parentPort, SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_KEEP))
963 {
964 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set %s for hostif of port %s",
965 hostif_vlan_tag[SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_KEEP], parentPort.m_alias.c_str());
966 return false;
967 }
968 }
969
970 parentPort.m_child_ports.insert(alias);
971 increasePortRefCount(parentPort.m_alias);
972
973 m_portList[alias] = p;
974 m_port_ref_count[alias] = 0;
975 port = p;
976 return true;
977}
978
979bool PortsOrch::removeSubPort(const string &alias)
980{
981 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
982
983 auto it = m_portList.find(alias);
984 if (it == m_portList.end())
985 {
986 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Sub interface %s Port object not found", alias.c_str());
987 return false;
988 }
989 Port &port = it->second;
990
991 if (port.m_type != Port::SUBPORT)
992 {
993 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Sub interface %s not of type sub port", alias.c_str());
994 return false;
995 }
996
997 if (m_port_ref_count[alias] > 0)
998 {
999 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Unable to remove sub interface %s: ref count %u", alias.c_str(), m_port_ref_count[alias]);
1000 return false;
1001 }
1002
1003 Port parentPort;
1004 if (!getPort(port.m_parent_port_id, parentPort))
1005 {
1006 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Sub interface %s: parent Port object not found", alias.c_str());
1007 }
1008
1009 if (!parentPort.m_child_ports.erase(alias))
1010 {
1011 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Sub interface %s not associated to parent port %s", alias.c_str(), parentPort.m_alias.c_str());
1012 }
1013 else
1014 {
1015 decreasePortRefCount(parentPort.m_alias);
1016 }
1017 m_portList[parentPort.m_alias] = parentPort;
1018
1019 m_portList.erase(it);
1020
1021 // Restore hostif vlan tag for the parent port when the last subport is removed
1022 if (parentPort.m_child_ports.empty())
1023 {
1024 if (parentPort.m_bridge_port_id == SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID)
1025 {
1026 if (!setHostIntfsStripTag(parentPort, SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_STRIP))
1027 {
1028 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set %s for hostif of port %s",
1029 hostif_vlan_tag[SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_STRIP], parentPort.m_alias.c_str());
1030 return false;
1031 }
1032 }
1033 }
1034
1035 return true;
1036}
1037
1038void PortsOrch::updateChildPortsMtu(const Port &p, const uint32_t mtu)
1039{
1040 if (p.m_type != Port::PHY && p.m_type != Port::LAG)
1041 {
1042 return;
1043 }
1044
1045 for (const auto &child_port : p.m_child_ports)
1046 {
1047 Port subp;
1048 if (!getPort(child_port, subp))
1049 {
1050 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Sub interface %s Port object not found", child_port.c_str());
1051 continue;
1052 }
1053
1054 subp.m_mtu = mtu;
1055 m_portList[child_port] = subp;
1056 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Sub interface %s inherits mtu change %u from parent port %s", child_port.c_str(), mtu, p.m_alias.c_str());
1057
1058 if (subp.m_rif_id)
1059 {
1060 gIntfsOrch->setRouterIntfsMtu(subp);
1061 }
1062 }
1063}
1064
1065void PortsOrch::setPort(string alias, Port p)
1066{
1067 m_portList[alias] = p;
1068}
1069
1070void PortsOrch::getCpuPort(Port &port)
1071{
1072 port = m_cpuPort;
1073}
1074
1075/*
1076 * Create host_tx_ready field in PORT_TABLE of STATE-DB
1077 * and set the field to false by default for the
1078 * front<Ethernet> port.
1079 */
1080void PortsOrch::initHostTxReadyState(Port &port)
1081{
1082 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1083
1084 vector<FieldValueTuple> tuples;
1085 bool exist = m_portStateTable.get(port.m_alias, tuples);
1086 string hostTxReady;
1087
1088 if (exist)
1089 {
1090 for (auto i : tuples)
1091 {
1092 if (fvField(i) == "host_tx_ready")
1093 {
1094 hostTxReady = fvValue(i);
1095 }
1096 }
1097 }
1098
1099 if (hostTxReady.empty())
1100 {
1101 m_portStateTable.hset(port.m_alias, "host_tx_ready", "false");
1102 SWSS_LOG_INFO("initalize hostTxReady %s with status %s",
1103 port.m_alias.c_str(), hostTxReady.c_str());
1104 }
1105}
1106
1107bool PortsOrch::setPortAdminStatus(Port &port, bool state)
1108{
1109 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1110
1111 sai_attribute_t attr;
1112 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_ADMIN_STATE;
1113 attr.value.booldata = state;
1114
1115 /* Update the host_tx_ready to false before setting admin_state, when admin state is false */
1116 if (!state)
1117 {
1118 m_portStateTable.hset(port.m_alias, "host_tx_ready", "false");
1119 SWSS_LOG_INFO("Set admin status DOWN host_tx_ready to false to port pid:%" PRIx64,
1120 port.m_port_id);
1121 }
1122
1123 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, &attr);
1124 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1125 {
1126 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set admin status %s to port pid:%" PRIx64,
1127 state ? "UP" : "DOWN", port.m_port_id);
1128 m_portStateTable.hset(port.m_alias, "host_tx_ready", "false");
1129 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1130 if (handle_status != task_success)
1131 {
1132 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1133 }
1134 }
1135
1136 bool gbstatus = setGearboxPortsAttr(port, SAI_PORT_ATTR_ADMIN_STATE, &state);
1137 if (gbstatus != true)
1138 {
1139 m_portStateTable.hset(port.m_alias, "host_tx_ready", "false");
1140 }
1141
1142 /* Update the state table for host_tx_ready*/
1143 if (state && (gbstatus == true) && (status == SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS) )
1144 {
1145 m_portStateTable.hset(port.m_alias, "host_tx_ready", "true");
1146 SWSS_LOG_INFO("Set admin status UP host_tx_ready to true to port pid:%" PRIx64,
1147 port.m_port_id);
1148 }
1149
1150 return true;
1151}
1152
1153bool PortsOrch::getPortAdminStatus(sai_object_id_t id, bool &up)
1154{
1155 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1156
1157 getDestPortId(id, LINE_PORT_TYPE, id);
1158
1159 sai_attribute_t attr;
1160 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_ADMIN_STATE;
1161
1162 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(id, 1, &attr);
1163 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1164 {
1165 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get admin status for port pid:%" PRIx64, id);
1166 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1167 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
1168 {
1169 return false;
1170 }
1171 }
1172
1173 up = attr.value.booldata;
1174
1175 return true;
1176}
1177
1178bool PortsOrch::getPortMtu(const Port& port, sai_uint32_t &mtu)
1179{
1180 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1181
1182 sai_attribute_t attr;
1183 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_MTU;
1184
1185 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, 1, &attr);
1186
1187 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1188 {
1189 return false;
1190 }
1191
1192 mtu = attr.value.u32 - (uint32_t)(sizeof(struct ether_header) + FCS_LEN + VLAN_TAG_LEN);
1193
1194 if (isMACsecPort(port.m_port_id))
1195 {
1196 mtu -= MAX_MACSEC_SECTAG_SIZE;
1197 }
1198
1199 return true;
1200}
1201
1202bool PortsOrch::setPortMtu(const Port& port, sai_uint32_t mtu)
1203{
1204 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1205
1206 sai_attribute_t attr;
1207 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_MTU;
1208 /* mtu + 14 + 4 + 4 = 22 bytes */
1209 mtu += (uint32_t)(sizeof(struct ether_header) + FCS_LEN + VLAN_TAG_LEN);
1210 attr.value.u32 = mtu;
1211
1212 if (isMACsecPort(port.m_port_id))
1213 {
1214 attr.value.u32 += MAX_MACSEC_SECTAG_SIZE;
1215 }
1216
1217 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, &attr);
1218 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1219 {
1220 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set MTU %u to port pid:%" PRIx64 ", rv:%d",
1221 attr.value.u32, port.m_port_id, status);
1222 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1223 if (handle_status != task_success)
1224 {
1225 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1226 }
1227 }
1228
1229 if (m_gearboxEnabled)
1230 {
1231 setGearboxPortsAttr(port, SAI_PORT_ATTR_MTU, &mtu);
1232 }
1233 SWSS_LOG_INFO("Set MTU %u to port pid:%" PRIx64, attr.value.u32, port.m_port_id);
1234 return true;
1235}
1236
1237
1238bool PortsOrch::setPortTpid(sai_object_id_t id, sai_uint16_t tpid)
1239{
1240 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1241 sai_status_t status = SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS;
1242 sai_attribute_t attr;
1243
1244 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_TPID;
1245
1246 attr.value.u16 = (uint16_t)tpid;
1247
1248 status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(id, &attr);
1249 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1250 {
1251 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set TPID 0x%x to port pid:%" PRIx64 ", rv:%d",
1252 attr.value.u16, id, status);
1253 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1254 if (handle_status != task_success)
1255 {
1256 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1257 }
1258 }
1259 else
1260 {
1261 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Set TPID 0x%x to port pid:%" PRIx64, attr.value.u16, id);
1262 }
1263 return true;
1264}
1265
1266bool PortsOrch::setPortFec(Port &port, string &mode)
1267{
1268 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1269
1270 auto searchRef = m_portSupportedFecModes.find(port.m_port_id);
1271 if (searchRef != m_portSupportedFecModes.end())
1272 {
1273 auto &supportedFecModes = searchRef->second;
1274 if (!supportedFecModes.empty() && (supportedFecModes.find(mode) == supportedFecModes.end()))
1275 {
1276 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Unsupported mode %s on port %s", mode.c_str(), port.m_alias.c_str());
1277 // We return true becase the caller will keep the item in m_toSync and retry it later if we return false
1278 // As the FEC mode is not supported it doesn't make sense to retry.
1279 return true;
1280 }
1281 }
1282
1283 sai_attribute_t attr;
1284 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_FEC_MODE;
1285 attr.value.s32 = port.m_fec_mode;
1286
1287 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, &attr);
1288 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1289 {
1290 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set FEC mode %s to port %s", mode.c_str(), port.m_alias.c_str());
1291 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1292 if (handle_status != task_success)
1293 {
1294 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1295 }
1296 }
1297
1298 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Set port %s FEC mode %s", port.m_alias.c_str(), mode.c_str());
1299
1300 setGearboxPortsAttr(port, SAI_PORT_ATTR_FEC_MODE, &port.m_fec_mode);
1301
1302 return true;
1303}
1304
1305bool PortsOrch::getPortPfc(sai_object_id_t portId, uint8_t *pfc_bitmask)
1306{
1307 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1308
1309 Port p;
1310
1311 if (!getPort(portId, p))
1312 {
1313 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get port object for port id 0x%" PRIx64, portId);
1314 return false;
1315 }
1316
1317 *pfc_bitmask = p.m_pfc_bitmask;
1318
1319 return true;
1320}
1321
1322bool PortsOrch::setPortPfc(sai_object_id_t portId, uint8_t pfc_bitmask)
1323{
1324 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1325
1326 sai_attribute_t attr;
1327 Port p;
1328
1329 if (!getPort(portId, p))
1330 {
1331 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get port object for port id 0x%" PRIx64, portId);
1332 return false;
1333 }
1334
1335 if (p.m_pfc_asym == SAI_PORT_PRIORITY_FLOW_CONTROL_MODE_COMBINED)
1336 {
1337 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_PRIORITY_FLOW_CONTROL;
1338 }
1339 else if (p.m_pfc_asym == SAI_PORT_PRIORITY_FLOW_CONTROL_MODE_SEPARATE)
1340 {
1341 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_PRIORITY_FLOW_CONTROL_TX;
1342 }
1343 else
1344 {
1345 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Incorrect asymmetric PFC mode: %u", p.m_pfc_asym);
1346 return false;
1347 }
1348
1349 attr.value.u8 = pfc_bitmask;
1350
1351 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(portId, &attr);
1352 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1353 {
1354 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set PFC 0x%x to port id 0x%" PRIx64 " (rc:%d)", attr.value.u8, portId, status);
1355 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1356 if (handle_status != task_success)
1357 {
1358 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1359 }
1360 }
1361
1362 if (p.m_pfc_bitmask != pfc_bitmask)
1363 {
1364 p.m_pfc_bitmask = pfc_bitmask;
1365 m_portList[p.m_alias] = p;
1366 }
1367
1368 return true;
1369}
1370
1371bool PortsOrch::setPortPfcWatchdogStatus(sai_object_id_t portId, uint8_t pfcwd_bitmask)
1372{
1373 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1374
1375 Port p;
1376
1377 if (!getPort(portId, p))
1378 {
1379 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get port object for port id 0x%" PRIx64, portId);
1380 return false;
1381 }
1382
1383 p.m_pfcwd_sw_bitmask = pfcwd_bitmask;
1384
1385 m_portList[p.m_alias] = p;
1386
1387 SWSS_LOG_INFO("Set PFC watchdog port id=0x%" PRIx64 ", bitmast=0x%x", portId, pfcwd_bitmask);
1388 return true;
1389}
1390
1391bool PortsOrch::getPortPfcWatchdogStatus(sai_object_id_t portId, uint8_t *pfcwd_bitmask)
1392{
1393 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1394
1395 Port p;
1396
1397 if (!pfcwd_bitmask || !getPort(portId, p))
1398 {
1399 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get port object for port id 0x%" PRIx64, portId);
1400 return false;
1401 }
1402
1403 *pfcwd_bitmask = p.m_pfcwd_sw_bitmask;
1404
1405 return true;
1406}
1407
1408bool PortsOrch::setPortPfcAsym(Port &port, string pfc_asym)
1409{
1410 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1411
1412 sai_attribute_t attr;
1413 uint8_t pfc = 0;
1414
1415 if (!getPortPfc(port.m_port_id, &pfc))
1416 {
1417 return false;
1418 }
1419
1420 auto found = pfc_asym_map.find(pfc_asym);
1421 if (found == pfc_asym_map.end())
1422 {
1423 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Incorrect asymmetric PFC mode: %s", pfc_asym.c_str());
1424 return false;
1425 }
1426
1427 auto new_pfc_asym = found->second;
1428 if (port.m_pfc_asym == new_pfc_asym)
1429 {
1430 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Already set asymmetric PFC mode: %s", pfc_asym.c_str());
1431 return true;
1432 }
1433
1434 port.m_pfc_asym = new_pfc_asym;
1435 m_portList[port.m_alias] = port;
1436
1437 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_PRIORITY_FLOW_CONTROL_MODE;
1438 attr.value.s32 = (int32_t) port.m_pfc_asym;
1439
1440 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, &attr);
1441 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1442 {
1443 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set PFC mode %d to port id 0x%" PRIx64 " (rc:%d)", port.m_pfc_asym, port.m_port_id, status);
1444 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1445 if (handle_status != task_success)
1446 {
1447 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1448 }
1449 }
1450
1451 if (!setPortPfc(port.m_port_id, pfc))
1452 {
1453 return false;
1454 }
1455
1456 if (port.m_pfc_asym == SAI_PORT_PRIORITY_FLOW_CONTROL_MODE_SEPARATE)
1457 {
1458 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_PRIORITY_FLOW_CONTROL_RX;
1459 attr.value.u8 = static_cast<uint8_t>(0xff);
1460
1461 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, &attr);
1462 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1463 {
1464 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set RX PFC 0x%x to port id 0x%" PRIx64 " (rc:%d)", attr.value.u8, port.m_port_id, status);
1465 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1466 if (handle_status != task_success)
1467 {
1468 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1469 }
1470 }
1471 }
1472
1473 SWSS_LOG_INFO("Set asymmetric PFC %s to port id 0x%" PRIx64, pfc_asym.c_str(), port.m_port_id);
1474
1475 return true;
1476}
1477
1478/*
1479 * Name: bindUnbindAclTableGroup
1480 *
1481 * Description:
1482 * To bind a port to ACL table we need to do two things.
1483 * 1. Create ACL table member, which maps
1484 * ACL table group OID --> ACL table OID
1485 * 2. Set ACL table group OID as value port attribute.
1486 *
1487 * This function performs the second step of binding.
1488 *
1489 * Also, while unbinding we use this function to
1490 * set port attribute value to SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID
1491 *
1492 * Port attribute name is derived from port type
1493 *
1494 * Return: true on success, false on failure
1495 */
1496bool PortsOrch::bindUnbindAclTableGroup(Port &port,
1497 bool ingress,
1498 bool bind)
1499{
1500
1501 sai_attribute_t attr;
1502 sai_status_t status = SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS;
1503 string bind_str = bind ? "bind" : "unbind";
1504
1505 attr.value.oid = bind ? (ingress ? port.m_ingress_acl_table_group_id :
1506 port.m_egress_acl_table_group_id):
1507 SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID;
1508 switch (port.m_type)
1509 {
1510 case Port::PHY:
1511 {
1512 attr.id = ingress ?
1513 SAI_PORT_ATTR_INGRESS_ACL : SAI_PORT_ATTR_EGRESS_ACL;
1514 status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, &attr);
1515 if (SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS != status)
1516 {
1517 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to %s %s to ACL table group %" PRIx64 ", rv:%d",
1518 bind_str.c_str(), port.m_alias.c_str(), attr.value.oid, status);
1519 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1520 if (handle_status != task_success)
1521 {
1522 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1523 }
1524 }
1525 break;
1526 }
1527 case Port::LAG:
1528 {
1529 attr.id = ingress ?
1530 SAI_LAG_ATTR_INGRESS_ACL : SAI_LAG_ATTR_EGRESS_ACL;
1531 status = sai_lag_api->set_lag_attribute(port.m_lag_id, &attr);
1532 if (SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS != status)
1533 {
1534 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to %s %s to ACL table group %" PRIx64 ", rv:%d",
1535 bind_str.c_str(), port.m_alias.c_str(), attr.value.oid, status);
1536 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_LAG, status);
1537 if (handle_status != task_success)
1538 {
1539 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1540 }
1541 }
1542 break;
1543 }
1544 case Port::VLAN:
1545 {
1546 attr.id = ingress ?
1547 SAI_VLAN_ATTR_INGRESS_ACL : SAI_VLAN_ATTR_EGRESS_ACL;
1548 status =
1549 sai_vlan_api->set_vlan_attribute(port.m_vlan_info.vlan_oid,
1550 &attr);
1551 if (SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS != status)
1552 {
1553 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to %s %s to ACL table group %" PRIx64 ", rv:%d",
1554 bind_str.c_str(), port.m_alias.c_str(), attr.value.oid, status);
1555 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_VLAN, status);
1556 if (handle_status != task_success)
1557 {
1558 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1559 }
1560 }
1561 break;
1562 }
1563 default:
1564 {
1565 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to %s %s port with type %d",
1566 bind_str.c_str(), port.m_alias.c_str(), port.m_type);
1567 return false;
1568 }
1569 }
1570
1571 return true;
1572}
1573
1574bool PortsOrch::unbindRemoveAclTableGroup(sai_object_id_t port_oid,
1575 sai_object_id_t acl_table_oid,
1576 acl_stage_type_t acl_stage)
1577{
1578 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1579
1580 sai_status_t status;
1581 bool ingress = (acl_stage == ACL_STAGE_INGRESS);
1582 Port port;
1583
1584 if (!getPort(port_oid, port))
1585 {
1586 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get port by port OID %" PRIx64, port_oid);
1587 return false;
1588 }
1589
1590
1591 sai_object_id_t &group_oid_ref =
1592 ingress? port.m_ingress_acl_table_group_id :
1593 port.m_egress_acl_table_group_id;
1594 unordered_set<sai_object_id_t> &acl_list_ref =
1595 ingress ? port.m_ingress_acl_tables_uset :
1596 port.m_egress_acl_tables_uset;
1597
1598 if (SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID == group_oid_ref)
1599 {
1600 assert(acl_list_ref.find(acl_table_oid) == acl_list_ref.end());
1601 return true;
1602 }
1603 assert(acl_list_ref.find(acl_table_oid) != acl_list_ref.end());
1604 acl_list_ref.erase(acl_table_oid);
1605 if (!acl_list_ref.empty())
1606 {
1607 // This port is in more than one acl table's port list
1608 // So, we need to preserve group OID
1609 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Preserving port OID %" PRIx64" ACL table grop ID", port_oid);
1610 setPort(port.m_alias, port);
1611 return true;
1612 }
1613
1614 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Removing port OID %" PRIx64" ACL table group ID", port_oid);
1615
1616 // Unbind ACL group
1617 if (!bindUnbindAclTableGroup(port, ingress, false))
1618 {
1619 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to remove ACL group ID from port");
1620 return false;
1621 }
1622
1623 // Remove ACL group
1624 status = sai_acl_api->remove_acl_table_group(group_oid_ref);
1625 if (SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS != status)
1626 {
1627 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to remove ACL table group, rv:%d", status);
1628 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiRemoveStatus(SAI_API_ACL, status);
1629 if (handle_status != task_success)
1630 {
1631 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1632 }
1633 }
1634 sai_acl_bind_point_type_t bind_type;
1635 if (!getSaiAclBindPointType(port.m_type, bind_type))
1636 {
1637 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Unknown SAI ACL bind point type");
1638 return false;
1639 }
1640 gCrmOrch->decCrmAclUsedCounter(CrmResourceType::CRM_ACL_GROUP,
1641 ingress ? SAI_ACL_STAGE_INGRESS : SAI_ACL_STAGE_EGRESS,
1642 bind_type, group_oid_ref);
1643
1644 group_oid_ref = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID;
1645 setPort(port.m_alias, port);
1646 return true;
1647}
1648
1649bool PortsOrch::createBindAclTableGroup(sai_object_id_t port_oid,
1650 sai_object_id_t acl_table_oid,
1651 sai_object_id_t &group_oid,
1652 acl_stage_type_t acl_stage)
1653{
1654 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1655
1656 if (ACL_STAGE_UNKNOWN == acl_stage)
1657 {
1658 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("unknown ACL stage for table group creation");
1659 return false;
1660 }
1661 assert(ACL_STAGE_INGRESS == acl_stage || ACL_STAGE_EGRESS == acl_stage);
1662
1663 sai_status_t status;
1664 Port port;
1665 bool ingress = (ACL_STAGE_INGRESS == acl_stage) ?
1666 true : false;
1667 if (!getPort(port_oid, port))
1668 {
1669 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get port by port ID %" PRIx64, port_oid);
1670 return false;
1671 }
1672
1673 unordered_set<sai_object_id_t> &acl_list_ref =
1674 ingress ? port.m_ingress_acl_tables_uset :
1675 port.m_egress_acl_tables_uset;
1676 sai_object_id_t &group_oid_ref =
1677 ingress ? port.m_ingress_acl_table_group_id :
1678 port.m_egress_acl_table_group_id;
1679
1680 if (acl_list_ref.empty())
1681 {
1682 // Port ACL table group does not exist, create one
1683 assert(group_oid_ref == SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID);
1684 sai_acl_bind_point_type_t bind_type;
1685 if (!getSaiAclBindPointType(port.m_type, bind_type))
1686 {
1687 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to bind ACL table to port %s with unknown type %d",
1688 port.m_alias.c_str(), port.m_type);
1689 return false;
1690 }
1691 sai_object_id_t bp_list[] = { bind_type };
1692
1693 vector<sai_attribute_t> group_attrs;
1694 sai_attribute_t group_attr;
1695
1696 group_attr.id = SAI_ACL_TABLE_GROUP_ATTR_ACL_STAGE;
1697 group_attr.value.s32 = ingress ? SAI_ACL_STAGE_INGRESS :
1698 SAI_ACL_STAGE_EGRESS;
1699 group_attrs.push_back(group_attr);
1700
1701 group_attr.id = SAI_ACL_TABLE_GROUP_ATTR_ACL_BIND_POINT_TYPE_LIST;
1702 group_attr.value.objlist.count = 1;
1703 group_attr.value.objlist.list = bp_list;
1704 group_attrs.push_back(group_attr);
1705
1706 group_attr.id = SAI_ACL_TABLE_GROUP_ATTR_TYPE;
1707 group_attr.value.s32 = SAI_ACL_TABLE_GROUP_TYPE_PARALLEL;
1708 group_attrs.push_back(group_attr);
1709
1710 status = sai_acl_api->create_acl_table_group(&group_oid_ref, gSwitchId,
1711 (uint32_t)group_attrs.size(), group_attrs.data());
1712 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1713 {
1714 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to create ACL table group, rv:%d", status);
1715 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiCreateStatus(SAI_API_ACL, status);
1716 if (handle_status != task_success)
1717 {
1718 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1719 }
1720 }
1721 assert(group_oid_ref != SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID);
1722
1723 gCrmOrch->incCrmAclUsedCounter(CrmResourceType::CRM_ACL_GROUP,
1724 ingress ? SAI_ACL_STAGE_INGRESS :
1725 SAI_ACL_STAGE_EGRESS, bind_type);
1726
1727 // Bind ACL table group
1728 if (!bindUnbindAclTableGroup(port, ingress, true))
1729 {
1730 return false;
1731 }
1732
1733 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Create %s ACL table group and bind port %s to it",
1734 ingress ? "ingress" : "egress", port.m_alias.c_str());
1735 }
1736
1737 assert(group_oid_ref != SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID);
1738 group_oid = group_oid_ref;
1739 acl_list_ref.insert(acl_table_oid);
1740 setPort(port.m_alias, port);
1741
1742 return true;
1743}
1744
1745bool PortsOrch::unbindAclTable(sai_object_id_t port_oid,
1746 sai_object_id_t acl_table_oid,
1747 sai_object_id_t acl_group_member_oid,
1748 acl_stage_type_t acl_stage)
1749{
1750
1751 /*
1752 * Do the following in-order
1753 * 1. Delete ACL table group member
1754 * 2. Unbind ACL table group
1755 * 3. Delete ACL table group
1756 */
1757 sai_status_t status =
1758 sai_acl_api->remove_acl_table_group_member(acl_group_member_oid);
1759 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS) {
1760 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to remove ACL group member: %" PRIu64 " ",
1761 acl_group_member_oid);
1762 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiRemoveStatus(SAI_API_ACL, status);
1763 if (handle_status != task_success)
1764 {
1765 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1766 }
1767 }
1768
1769
1770 Port port;
1771 if (getPort(port_oid, port))
1772 {
1773 decreasePortRefCount(port.m_alias);
1774 }
1775
1776 if (!unbindRemoveAclTableGroup(port_oid, acl_table_oid, acl_stage)) {
1777 return false;
1778 }
1779
1780 return true;
1781}
1782
1783bool PortsOrch::bindAclTable(sai_object_id_t port_oid,
1784 sai_object_id_t table_oid,
1785 sai_object_id_t &group_member_oid,
1786 acl_stage_type_t acl_stage)
1787{
1788 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1789 /*
1790 * Do the following in-order
1791 * 1. Create ACL table group
1792 * 2. Bind ACL table group (set ACL table group ID on port)
1793 * 3. Create ACL table group member
1794 */
1795
1796 if (table_oid == SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID)
1797 {
1798 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Invalid ACL table %" PRIx64, table_oid);
1799 return false;
1800 }
1801
1802 sai_object_id_t group_oid;
1803 sai_status_t status;
1804
1805 // Create an ACL table group and bind to port
1806 if (!createBindAclTableGroup(port_oid, table_oid, group_oid, acl_stage))
1807 {
1808 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Fail to create or bind to port %" PRIx64 " ACL table group", port_oid);
1809 return false;
1810 }
1811
1812 // Create an ACL group member with table_oid and group_oid
1813 vector<sai_attribute_t> member_attrs;
1814
1815 sai_attribute_t member_attr;
1816 member_attr.id = SAI_ACL_TABLE_GROUP_MEMBER_ATTR_ACL_TABLE_GROUP_ID;
1817 member_attr.value.oid = group_oid;
1818 member_attrs.push_back(member_attr);
1819
1820 member_attr.id = SAI_ACL_TABLE_GROUP_MEMBER_ATTR_ACL_TABLE_ID;
1821 member_attr.value.oid = table_oid;
1822 member_attrs.push_back(member_attr);
1823
1824 member_attr.id = SAI_ACL_TABLE_GROUP_MEMBER_ATTR_PRIORITY;
1825 member_attr.value.u32 = 100; // TODO: double check!
1826 member_attrs.push_back(member_attr);
1827
1828 status = sai_acl_api->create_acl_table_group_member(&group_member_oid, gSwitchId, (uint32_t)member_attrs.size(), member_attrs.data());
1829 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1830 {
1831 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to create member in ACL table group %" PRIx64 " for ACL table %" PRIx64 ", rv:%d",
1832 group_oid, table_oid, status);
1833 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiCreateStatus(SAI_API_ACL, status);
1834 if (handle_status != task_success)
1835 {
1836 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1837 }
1838 }
1839
1840 Port port;
1841 if (getPort(port_oid, port))
1842 {
1843 increasePortRefCount(port.m_alias);
1844 }
1845
1846 return true;
1847}
1848
1849bool PortsOrch::setPortPvid(Port &port, sai_uint32_t pvid)
1850{
1851 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1852
1853 if(port.m_type == Port::TUNNEL)
1854 {
1855 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("pvid setting for tunnel %s is not allowed", port.m_alias.c_str());
1856 return true;
1857 }
1858
1859 if(port.m_type == Port::SYSTEM)
1860 {
1861 SWSS_LOG_INFO("pvid setting for system port %s is not applicable", port.m_alias.c_str());
1862 return true;
1863 }
1864
1865 if (port.m_rif_id)
1866 {
1867 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("pvid setting for router interface %s is not allowed", port.m_alias.c_str());
1868 return false;
1869 }
1870
1871 vector<Port> portv;
1872 if (port.m_type == Port::PHY)
1873 {
1874 sai_attribute_t attr;
1875 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_PORT_VLAN_ID;
1876 attr.value.u32 = pvid;
1877
1878 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, &attr);
1879 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1880 {
1881 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set pvid %u to port: %s", attr.value.u32, port.m_alias.c_str());
1882 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
1883 if (handle_status != task_success)
1884 {
1885 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1886 }
1887 }
1888 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Set pvid %u to port: %s", attr.value.u32, port.m_alias.c_str());
1889 }
1890 else if (port.m_type == Port::LAG)
1891 {
1892 sai_attribute_t attr;
1893 attr.id = SAI_LAG_ATTR_PORT_VLAN_ID;
1894 attr.value.u32 = pvid;
1895
1896 sai_status_t status = sai_lag_api->set_lag_attribute(port.m_lag_id, &attr);
1897 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1898 {
1899 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set pvid %u to lag: %s", attr.value.u32, port.m_alias.c_str());
1900 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_LAG, status);
1901 if (handle_status != task_success)
1902 {
1903 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1904 }
1905 }
1906 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Set pvid %u to lag: %s", attr.value.u32, port.m_alias.c_str());
1907 }
1908 else
1909 {
1910 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("PortsOrch::setPortPvid port type %d not supported", port.m_type);
1911 return false;
1912 }
1913
1914 port.m_port_vlan_id = (sai_vlan_id_t)pvid;
1915 return true;
1916}
1917
1918bool PortsOrch::getPortPvid(Port &port, sai_uint32_t &pvid)
1919{
1920 /* Just return false if the router interface exists */
1921 if (port.m_rif_id)
1922 {
1923 SWSS_LOG_DEBUG("Router interface exists on %s, don't set pvid",
1924 port.m_alias.c_str());
1925 return false;
1926 }
1927
1928 pvid = port.m_port_vlan_id;
1929 return true;
1930}
1931
1932bool PortsOrch::setHostIntfsStripTag(Port &port, sai_hostif_vlan_tag_t strip)
1933{
1934 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
1935 vector<Port> portv;
1936
1937 if(port.m_type == Port::TUNNEL)
1938 {
1939 return true;
1940 }
1941
1942 /*
1943 * Before SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_ORIGINAL is supported by libsai from all asic vendors,
1944 * the VLAN tag on hostif is explicitly controlled with SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_STRIP &
1945 * SAI_HOSTIF_VLAN_TAG_KEEP attributes.
1946 */
1947 if (port.m_type == Port::PHY)
1948 {
1949 portv.push_back(port);
1950 }
1951 else if (port.m_type == Port::LAG)
1952 {
1953 getLagMember(port, portv);
1954 }
1955 else
1956 {
1957 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("port type %d not supported", port.m_type);
1958 return false;
1959 }
1960
1961 for (const auto p: portv)
1962 {
1963 sai_attribute_t attr;
1964 attr.id = SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_VLAN_TAG;
1965 attr.value.s32 = strip;
1966
1967 sai_status_t status = sai_hostif_api->set_hostif_attribute(p.m_hif_id, &attr);
1968 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
1969 {
1970 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set %s to host interface %s",
1971 hostif_vlan_tag[strip], p.m_alias.c_str());
1972 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_HOSTIF, status);
1973 if (handle_status != task_success)
1974 {
1975 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
1976 }
1977 }
1978 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Set %s to host interface: %s",
1979 hostif_vlan_tag[strip], p.m_alias.c_str());
1980 }
1981
1982 return true;
1983}
1984
1985bool PortsOrch::isSpeedSupported(const std::string& alias, sai_object_id_t port_id, sai_uint32_t speed)
1986{
1987 // This method will return false iff we get a list of supported speeds and the requested speed
1988 // is not supported
1989 // Otherwise the method will return true (even if we received errors)
1990 initPortSupportedSpeeds(alias, port_id);
1991
1992 const auto &supp_speeds = m_portSupportedSpeeds[port_id];
1993 if (supp_speeds.empty())
1994 {
1995 // we don't have the list for this port, so return true to change speed anyway
1996 return true;
1997 }
1998
1999 return std::find(supp_speeds.begin(), supp_speeds.end(), speed) != supp_speeds.end();
2000}
2001
2002void PortsOrch::getPortSupportedSpeeds(const std::string& alias, sai_object_id_t port_id, PortSupportedSpeeds &supported_speeds)
2003{
2004 sai_attribute_t attr;
2005 sai_status_t status;
2006 const auto size_guess = 25; // Guess the size which could be enough
2007
2008 PortSupportedSpeeds speeds(size_guess);
2009
2010 // two attempts to get our value, first with the guess, other with the returned value
2011 for (int attempt = 0; attempt < 2; ++attempt)
2012 {
2013 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_SUPPORTED_SPEED;
2014 attr.value.u32list.count = static_cast<uint32_t>(speeds.size());
2015 attr.value.u32list.list = speeds.data();
2016
2017 status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(port_id, 1, &attr);
2018 if (status != SAI_STATUS_BUFFER_OVERFLOW)
2019 {
2020 break;
2021 }
2022
2023 // if our guess was wrong, retry with the correct value
2024 speeds.resize(attr.value.u32list.count);
2025 }
2026
2027 if (status == SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2028 {
2029 speeds.resize(attr.value.u32list.count);
2030 supported_speeds.swap(speeds);
2031 }
2032 else
2033 {
2034 if (status == SAI_STATUS_BUFFER_OVERFLOW)
2035 {
2036 // something went wrong in SAI implementation
2037 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get supported speed list for port %s id=%" PRIx64 ". Not enough container size",
2038 alias.c_str(), port_id);
2039 }
2040 else if (SAI_STATUS_IS_ATTR_NOT_SUPPORTED(status) ||
2041 SAI_STATUS_IS_ATTR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED(status) ||
2042 status == SAI_STATUS_NOT_IMPLEMENTED)
2043 {
2044 // unable to validate speed if attribute is not supported on platform
2045 // assuming input value is correct
2046 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Unable to validate speed for port %s id=%" PRIx64 ". Not supported by platform",
2047 alias.c_str(), port_id);
2048 }
2049 else
2050 {
2051 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get a list of supported speeds for port %s id=%" PRIx64 ". Error=%d",
2052 alias.c_str(), port_id, status);
2053 }
2054
2055 supported_speeds.clear(); // return empty
2056 }
2057}
2058
2059void PortsOrch::initPortSupportedSpeeds(const std::string& alias, sai_object_id_t port_id)
2060{
2061 // If port supported speeds map already contains the information, save the SAI call
2062 if (m_portSupportedSpeeds.count(port_id))
2063 {
2064 return;
2065 }
2066 PortSupportedSpeeds supported_speeds;
2067 getPortSupportedSpeeds(alias, port_id, supported_speeds);
2068 m_portSupportedSpeeds[port_id] = supported_speeds;
2069 vector<FieldValueTuple> v;
2070 std::string supported_speeds_str = swss::join(',', supported_speeds.begin(), supported_speeds.end());
2071 v.emplace_back(std::make_pair("supported_speeds", supported_speeds_str));
2072 m_portStateTable.set(alias, v);
2073}
2074
2075
2076void PortsOrch::initPortCapAutoNeg(Port &port)
2077{
2078 sai_status_t status;
2079 sai_attribute_t attr;
2080
2081 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_SUPPORTED_AUTO_NEG_MODE;
2082 status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, 1, &attr);
2083 if (status == SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2084 {
2085 port.m_cap_an = attr.value.booldata ? 1 : 0;
2086 }
2087 else
2088 {
2089 // To avoid breakage on the existing platforms, AN should be 1 by default
2090 port.m_cap_an = 1;
2091 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Unable to get %s AN support capability",
2092 port.m_alias.c_str());
2093 }
2094}
2095
2096void PortsOrch::initPortCapLinkTraining(Port &port)
2097{
2098 // TODO:
2099 // Add SAI_PORT_ATTR_SUPPORTED_LINK_TRAINING_MODE query when it is
2100 // available in the saiport.h of SAI.
2101 port.m_cap_lt = 1;
2102 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Unable to get %s LT support capability", port.m_alias.c_str());
2103}
2104
2105void PortsOrch::getPortSupportedFecModes(const std::string& alias, sai_object_id_t port_id, PortSupportedFecModes &supported_fecmodes)
2106{
2107 sai_attribute_t attr;
2108 sai_status_t status;
2109 vector<sai_int32_t> fecModes(fec_mode_reverse_map.size());
2110
2111 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_SUPPORTED_FEC_MODE;
2112 attr.value.s32list.count = static_cast<uint32_t>(fecModes.size());
2113 attr.value.s32list.list = fecModes.data();
2114
2115 status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(port_id, 1, &attr);
2116 fecModes.resize(attr.value.s32list.count);
2117 if (status == SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2118 {
2119 if (fecModes.empty())
2120 {
2121 supported_fecmodes.insert("N/A");
2122 }
2123 else
2124 {
2125 for(auto fecMode : fecModes)
2126 {
2127 supported_fecmodes.insert(fec_mode_reverse_map[static_cast<sai_port_fec_mode_t>(fecMode)]);
2128 }
2129 }
2130 }
2131 else
2132 {
2133 if (SAI_STATUS_IS_ATTR_NOT_SUPPORTED(status) ||
2134 SAI_STATUS_IS_ATTR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED(status) ||
2135 status == SAI_STATUS_NOT_IMPLEMENTED)
2136 {
2137 // unable to validate FEC mode if attribute is not supported on platform
2138 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Unable to validate FEC mode for port %s id=%" PRIx64 " due to unsupported by platform",
2139 alias.c_str(), port_id);
2140 }
2141 else
2142 {
2143 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get a list of supported FEC modes for port %s id=%" PRIx64 ". Error=%d",
2144 alias.c_str(), port_id, status);
2145 }
2146
2147 supported_fecmodes.clear(); // return empty
2148 }
2149}
2150
2151void PortsOrch::initPortSupportedFecModes(const std::string& alias, sai_object_id_t port_id)
2152{
2153 // If port supported speeds map already contains the information, save the SAI call
2154 if (m_portSupportedFecModes.count(port_id))
2155 {
2156 return;
2157 }
2158 PortSupportedFecModes supported_fec_modes;
2159 getPortSupportedFecModes(alias, port_id, supported_fec_modes);
2160 m_portSupportedFecModes[port_id] = supported_fec_modes;
2161
2162 if (supported_fec_modes.empty())
2163 {
2164 // Do not expose "supported_fecs" in case fetching FEC modes is not supported by the vendor
2165 SWSS_LOG_INFO("No supported_fecs exposed to STATE_DB for port %s since fetching supported FEC modes is not supported by the vendor",
2166 alias.c_str());
2167 return;
2168 }
2169
2170 vector<FieldValueTuple> v;
2171 std::string supported_fec_modes_str;
2172 bool first = true;
2173 for(auto fec : supported_fec_modes)
2174 {
2175 if (first)
2176 first = false;
2177 else
2178 supported_fec_modes_str += ',';
2179 supported_fec_modes_str += fec;
2180 }
2181
2182 v.emplace_back(std::make_pair("supported_fecs", supported_fec_modes_str));
2183 m_portStateTable.set(alias, v);
2184}
2185
2186/*
2187 * If Gearbox is enabled and this is a Gearbox port then set the attributes accordingly.
2188 */
2189bool PortsOrch::setGearboxPortsAttr(const Port &port, sai_port_attr_t id, void *value)
2190{
2191 bool status = false;
2192
2193 status = setGearboxPortAttr(port, PHY_PORT_TYPE, id, value);
2194
2195 if (status == true)
2196 {
2197 status = setGearboxPortAttr(port, LINE_PORT_TYPE, id, value);
2198 }
2199
2200 return status;
2201}
2202
2203/*
2204 * If Gearbox is enabled and this is a Gearbox port then set the specific lane attribute.
2205 * Note: the appl_db is also updated (Gearbox config_db tables are TBA).
2206 */
2207bool PortsOrch::setGearboxPortAttr(const Port &port, dest_port_type_t port_type, sai_port_attr_t id, void *value)
2208{
2209 sai_status_t status = SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS;
2210 sai_object_id_t dest_port_id;
2211 sai_attribute_t attr;
2212 string speed_attr;
2213 sai_uint32_t speed = 0;
2214
2215 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2216
2217 if (m_gearboxEnabled)
2218 {
2219 if (getDestPortId(port.m_port_id, port_type, dest_port_id) == true)
2220 {
2221 switch (id)
2222 {
2223 case SAI_PORT_ATTR_FEC_MODE:
2224 attr.id = id;
2225 attr.value.s32 = *static_cast<sai_int32_t*>(value);
2226 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("BOX: Set %s FEC_MODE %d", port.m_alias.c_str(), attr.value.s32);
2227 break;
2228 case SAI_PORT_ATTR_ADMIN_STATE:
2229 attr.id = id;
2230 attr.value.booldata = *static_cast<bool*>(value);
2231 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("BOX: Set %s ADMIN_STATE %d", port.m_alias.c_str(), attr.value.booldata);
2232 break;
2233 case SAI_PORT_ATTR_SPEED:
2234 switch (port_type)
2235 {
2236 case PHY_PORT_TYPE:
2237 speed_attr = "system_speed";
2238 break;
2239 case LINE_PORT_TYPE:
2240 speed_attr = "line_speed";
2241 break;
2242 default:
2243 return false;
2244 }
2245
2246 speed = *static_cast<sai_int32_t*>(value);
2247 if (isSpeedSupported(port.m_alias, dest_port_id, speed))
2248 {
2249 // Gearbox may not implement speed check, so
2250 // invalidate speed if it doesn't make sense.
2251 if (to_string(speed).size() < 5)
2252 {
2253 speed = 0;
2254 }
2255
2256 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_SPEED;
2257 attr.value.u32 = speed;
2258 }
2259 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("BOX: Set %s lane %s %d", port.m_alias.c_str(), speed_attr.c_str(), speed);
2260 break;
2261 case SAI_PORT_ATTR_MTU:
2262 attr.id = id;
2263 attr.value.u32 = *static_cast<sai_uint32_t*>(value);
2264 if (LINE_PORT_TYPE == port_type && isMACsecPort(dest_port_id))
2265 {
2266 attr.value.u32 += MAX_MACSEC_SECTAG_SIZE;
2267 }
2268 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("BOX: Set %s MTU %d", port.m_alias.c_str(), attr.value.u32);
2269 break;
2270 default:
2271 return false;
2272 }
2273
2274 status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(dest_port_id, &attr);
2275 if (status == SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2276 {
2277 if (id == SAI_PORT_ATTR_SPEED)
2278 {
2279 string key = "phy:"+to_string(m_gearboxInterfaceMap[port.m_index].phy_id)+":ports:"+to_string(port.m_index);
2280 m_gearboxTable->hset(key, speed_attr, to_string(speed));
2281 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("BOX: Updated APPL_DB key:%s %s %d", key.c_str(), speed_attr.c_str(), speed);
2282 }
2283 }
2284 else
2285 {
2286 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("BOX: Failed to set %s port attribute %d", port.m_alias.c_str(), id);
2287 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
2288 if (handle_status != task_success)
2289 {
2290 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
2291 }
2292 }
2293 }
2294 }
2295
2296 return true;
2297}
2298
2299task_process_status PortsOrch::setPortSpeed(Port &port, sai_uint32_t speed)
2300{
2301 sai_attribute_t attr;
2302 sai_status_t status;
2303
2304 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2305
2306 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_SPEED;
2307 attr.value.u32 = speed;
2308
2309 status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, &attr);
2310 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2311 {
2312 return handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
2313 }
2314
2315 setGearboxPortsAttr(port, SAI_PORT_ATTR_SPEED, &speed);
2316 return task_success;
2317}
2318
2319bool PortsOrch::getPortSpeed(sai_object_id_t id, sai_uint32_t &speed)
2320{
2321 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2322
2323 getDestPortId(id, LINE_PORT_TYPE, id);
2324
2325 sai_attribute_t attr;
2326 sai_status_t status;
2327
2328 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_SPEED;
2329 attr.value.u32 = 0;
2330
2331 status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(id, 1, &attr);
2332
2333 if (status == SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2334 {
2335 speed = attr.value.u32;
2336 }
2337 else
2338 {
2339 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
2340 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
2341 {
2342 return false;
2343 }
2344 }
2345
2346 return true;
2347}
2348
2349bool PortsOrch::getPortAdvSpeeds(const Port& port, bool remote, std::vector<sai_uint32_t>& speed_list)
2350{
2351 sai_object_id_t port_id = port.m_port_id;
2352 sai_object_id_t line_port_id;
2353 sai_attribute_t attr;
2354 sai_status_t status;
2355 std::vector<sai_uint32_t> speeds(PORT_SPEED_LIST_DEFAULT_SIZE);
2356
2357 attr.id = remote ? SAI_PORT_ATTR_REMOTE_ADVERTISED_SPEED : SAI_PORT_ATTR_ADVERTISED_SPEED;
2358 attr.value.u32list.count = static_cast<uint32_t>(speeds.size());
2359 attr.value.u32list.list = speeds.data();
2360
2361 if (getDestPortId(port_id, LINE_PORT_TYPE, line_port_id))
2362 {
2363 status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(line_port_id, 1, &attr);
2364 }
2365 else
2366 {
2367 status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(port_id, 1, &attr);
2368 }
2369 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2370 {
2371 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Unable to get advertised speed for %s", port.m_alias.c_str());
2372 return false;
2373 }
2374 speeds.resize(attr.value.u32list.count);
2375 speed_list.swap(speeds);
2376 return true;
2377}
2378
2379bool PortsOrch::getPortAdvSpeeds(const Port& port, bool remote, string& adv_speeds)
2380{
2381 std::vector<sai_uint32_t> speed_list;
2382 bool rc = getPortAdvSpeeds(port, remote, speed_list);
2383
2384 adv_speeds = rc ? swss::join(',', speed_list.begin(), speed_list.end()) : "";
2385 return rc;
2386}
2387
2388task_process_status PortsOrch::setPortAdvSpeeds(sai_object_id_t port_id, std::vector<sai_uint32_t>& speed_list)
2389{
2390 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2391 sai_attribute_t attr;
2392 sai_status_t status;
2393
2394 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_ADVERTISED_SPEED;
2395 attr.value.u32list.list = speed_list.data();
2396 attr.value.u32list.count = static_cast<uint32_t>(speed_list.size());
2397
2398 status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port_id, &attr);
2399 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2400 {
2401 return handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
2402 }
2403
2404 return task_success;
2405}
2406
2407task_process_status PortsOrch::setPortInterfaceType(sai_object_id_t port_id, sai_port_interface_type_t interface_type)
2408{
2409 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2410 sai_attribute_t attr;
2411 sai_status_t status;
2412
2413 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_INTERFACE_TYPE;
2414 attr.value.u32 = static_cast<uint32_t>(interface_type);
2415
2416 status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port_id, &attr);
2417 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2418 {
2419 return handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
2420 }
2421
2422 return task_success;
2423}
2424
2425task_process_status PortsOrch::setPortAdvInterfaceTypes(sai_object_id_t port_id, std::vector<uint32_t> &interface_types)
2426{
2427 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2428 sai_attribute_t attr;
2429 sai_status_t status;
2430
2431 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_ADVERTISED_INTERFACE_TYPE;
2432 attr.value.u32list.list = interface_types.data();
2433 attr.value.u32list.count = static_cast<uint32_t>(interface_types.size());
2434
2435 status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port_id, &attr);
2436 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2437 {
2438 return handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
2439 }
2440
2441 return task_success;
2442}
2443
2444bool PortsOrch::getQueueTypeAndIndex(sai_object_id_t queue_id, string &type, uint8_t &index)
2445{
2446 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2447
2448 sai_attribute_t attr[2];
2449 attr[0].id = SAI_QUEUE_ATTR_TYPE;
2450 attr[1].id = SAI_QUEUE_ATTR_INDEX;
2451
2452 sai_status_t status = sai_queue_api->get_queue_attribute(queue_id, 2, attr);
2453 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2454 {
2455 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get queue type and index for queue %" PRIu64 " rv:%d", queue_id, status);
2456 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiGetStatus(SAI_API_QUEUE, status);
2457 if (handle_status != task_process_status::task_success)
2458 {
2459 return false;
2460 }
2461 }
2462
2463 switch (attr[0].value.s32)
2464 {
2465 case SAI_QUEUE_TYPE_ALL:
2466 type = "SAI_QUEUE_TYPE_ALL";
2467 break;
2468 case SAI_QUEUE_TYPE_UNICAST:
2469 type = "SAI_QUEUE_TYPE_UNICAST";
2470 break;
2471 case SAI_QUEUE_TYPE_MULTICAST:
2472 type = "SAI_QUEUE_TYPE_MULTICAST";
2473 break;
2474 case SAI_QUEUE_TYPE_UNICAST_VOQ:
2475 type = "SAI_QUEUE_TYPE_UNICAST_VOQ";
2476 break;
2477 default:
2478 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Got unsupported queue type %d for %" PRIu64 " queue", attr[0].value.s32, queue_id);
2479 throw runtime_error("Got unsupported queue type");
2480 }
2481
2482 index = attr[1].value.u8;
2483
2484 return true;
2485}
2486
2487bool PortsOrch::isAutoNegEnabled(sai_object_id_t id)
2488{
2489 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2490
2491 sai_attribute_t attr;
2492 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_AUTO_NEG_MODE;
2493
2494 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->get_port_attribute(id, 1, &attr);
2495 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2496 {
2497 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to get port AutoNeg status for port pid:%" PRIx64, id);
2498 return false;
2499 }
2500
2501 return attr.value.booldata;
2502}
2503
2504task_process_status PortsOrch::setPortAutoNeg(sai_object_id_t id, int an)
2505{
2506 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2507
2508 sai_attribute_t attr;
2509 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_AUTO_NEG_MODE;
2510 attr.value.booldata = (an == 1 ? true : false);
2511
2512 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(id, &attr);
2513 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2514 {
2515 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set AutoNeg %u to port pid:%" PRIx64, attr.value.booldata, id);
2516 return handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
2517 }
2518 SWSS_LOG_INFO("Set AutoNeg %u to port pid:%" PRIx64, attr.value.booldata, id);
2519 return task_success;
2520}
2521
2522task_process_status PortsOrch::setPortLinkTraining(const Port &port, bool state)
2523{
2524 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2525
2526 if (port.m_type != Port::PHY)
2527 {
2528 return task_failed;
2529 }
2530
2531 sai_attribute_t attr;
2532 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_LINK_TRAINING_ENABLE;
2533 attr.value.booldata = state;
2534
2535 string op = state ? "on" : "off";
2536 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->set_port_attribute(port.m_port_id, &attr);
2537 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2538 {
2539 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to set LT %s to port %s", op.c_str(), port.m_alias.c_str());
2540 return handleSaiSetStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
2541 }
2542
2543 SWSS_LOG_INFO("Set LT %s to port %s", op.c_str(), port.m_alias.c_str());
2544
2545 return task_success;
2546}
2547
2548bool PortsOrch::setHostIntfsOperStatus(const Port& port, bool isUp) const
2549{
2550 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2551
2552 sai_attribute_t attr;
2553 attr.id = SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS;
2554 attr.value.booldata = isUp;
2555
2556 sai_status_t status = sai_hostif_api->set_hostif_attribute(port.m_hif_id, &attr);
2557 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2558 {
2559 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Failed to set operation status %s to host interface %s",
2560 isUp ? "UP" : "DOWN", port.m_alias.c_str());
2561 return false;
2562 }
2563
2564 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Set operation status %s to host interface %s",
2565 isUp ? "UP" : "DOWN", port.m_alias.c_str());
2566
2567 event_params_t params = {{"ifname",port.m_alias},{"status",isUp ? "up" : "down"}};
2568 event_publish(g_events_handle, "if-state", &params);
2569 return true;
2570}
2571
2572bool PortsOrch::createVlanHostIntf(Port& vl, string hostif_name)
2573{
2574 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2575
2576 if (vl.m_vlan_info.host_intf_id != SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID)
2577 {
2578 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Host interface already assigned to VLAN %d", vl.m_vlan_info.vlan_id);
2579 return false;
2580 }
2581
2582 vector<sai_attribute_t> attrs;
2583 sai_attribute_t attr;
2584
2585 attr.id = SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_TYPE;
2586 attr.value.s32 = SAI_HOSTIF_TYPE_NETDEV;
2587 attrs.push_back(attr);
2588
2589 attr.id = SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OBJ_ID;
2590 attr.value.oid = vl.m_vlan_info.vlan_oid;
2591 attrs.push_back(attr);
2592
2593 attr.id = SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_NAME;
2594 if (hostif_name.length() >= SAI_HOSTIF_NAME_SIZE)
2595 {
2596 SWSS_LOG_WARN("Host interface name %s is too long and will be truncated to %d bytes", hostif_name.c_str(), SAI_HOSTIF_NAME_SIZE - 1);
2597 }
2598 strncpy(attr.value.chardata, hostif_name.c_str(), SAI_HOSTIF_NAME_SIZE);
2599 attr.value.chardata[SAI_HOSTIF_NAME_SIZE - 1] = '\0';
2600 attrs.push_back(attr);
2601
2602 sai_status_t status = sai_hostif_api->create_hostif(&vl.m_vlan_info.host_intf_id, gSwitchId, (uint32_t)attrs.size(), attrs.data());
2603 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2604 {
2605 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to create host interface %s for VLAN %d", hostif_name.c_str(), vl.m_vlan_info.vlan_id);
2606 return false;
2607 }
2608
2609 m_portList[vl.m_alias] = vl;
2610
2611 return true;
2612}
2613
2614bool PortsOrch::removeVlanHostIntf(Port vl)
2615{
2616 sai_status_t status = sai_hostif_api->remove_hostif(vl.m_vlan_info.host_intf_id);
2617 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2618 {
2619 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to remove VLAN %d host interface", vl.m_vlan_info.vlan_id);
2620 return false;
2621 }
2622
2623 return true;
2624}
2625
2626void PortsOrch::updateDbPortOperStatus(const Port& port, sai_port_oper_status_t status) const
2627{
2628 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2629
2630 if(port.m_type == Port::TUNNEL)
2631 {
2632 VxlanTunnelOrch* tunnel_orch = gDirectory.get<VxlanTunnelOrch*>();
2633 tunnel_orch->updateDbTunnelOperStatus(port.m_alias, status);
2634 return;
2635 }
2636
2637 vector<FieldValueTuple> tuples;
2638 FieldValueTuple tuple("oper_status", oper_status_strings.at(status));
2639 tuples.push_back(tuple);
2640 m_portTable->set(port.m_alias, tuples);
2641}
2642
2643bool PortsOrch::addPort(const set<int> &lane_set, uint32_t speed, int an, string fec_mode)
2644{
2645 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2646
2647 if (!speed || lane_set.empty())
2648 {
2649 /*
2650 speed and lane list are mandatory attributes for the initial create_port call
2651 This check is required because the incoming notifs may not be atomic
2652 */
2653 return true;
2654 }
2655
2656 vector<uint32_t> lanes(lane_set.begin(), lane_set.end());
2657
2658 sai_attribute_t attr;
2659 vector<sai_attribute_t> attrs;
2660
2661 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_SPEED;
2662 attr.value.u32 = speed;
2663 attrs.push_back(attr);
2664
2665 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_HW_LANE_LIST;
2666 attr.value.u32list.list = lanes.data();
2667 attr.value.u32list.count = static_cast<uint32_t>(lanes.size());
2668 attrs.push_back(attr);
2669
2670 if (an == true)
2671 {
2672 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_AUTO_NEG_MODE;
2673 attr.value.booldata = true;
2674 attrs.push_back(attr);
2675 }
2676
2677 if (!fec_mode.empty())
2678 {
2679 attr.id = SAI_PORT_ATTR_FEC_MODE;
2680 attr.value.u32 = fec_mode_map[fec_mode];
2681 attrs.push_back(attr);
2682 }
2683
2684 sai_object_id_t port_id;
2685 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->create_port(&port_id, gSwitchId, static_cast<uint32_t>(attrs.size()), attrs.data());
2686 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2687 {
2688 SWSS_LOG_ERROR("Failed to create port with the speed %u, rv:%d", speed, status);
2689 task_process_status handle_status = handleSaiCreateStatus(SAI_API_PORT, status);
2690 if (handle_status != task_success)
2691 {
2692 return parseHandleSaiStatusFailure(handle_status);
2693 }
2694 }
2695
2696 m_portListLaneMap[lane_set] = port_id;
2697 m_portCount++;
2698
2699 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Create port %" PRIx64 " with the speed %u", port_id, speed);
2700
2701 return true;
2702}
2703
2704sai_status_t PortsOrch::removePort(sai_object_id_t port_id)
2705{
2706 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2707
2708 Port port;
2709
2710 /*
2711 * Make sure to bring down admin state.
2712 * SET would have replaced with DEL
2713 */
2714 if (getPort(port_id, port))
2715 {
2716 setPortAdminStatus(port, false);
2717 }
2718 /* else : port is in default state or not yet created */
2719
2720 /*
2721 * Remove port serdes (if exists) before removing port since this
2722 * reference is dependency.
2723 */
2724
2725 removePortSerdesAttribute(port_id);
2726
2727 sai_status_t status = sai_port_api->remove_port(port_id);
2728 if (status != SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS)
2729 {
2730 return status;
2731 }
2732
2733 m_portCount--;
2734 m_portSupportedSpeeds.erase(port_id);
2735 SWSS_LOG_NOTICE("Remove port %" PRIx64, port_id);
2736
2737 return status;
2738}
2739
2740string PortsOrch::getQueueWatermarkFlexCounterTableKey(string key)
2741{
2742 return string(QUEUE_WATERMARK_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP) + ":" + key;
2743}
2744
2745string PortsOrch::getPriorityGroupWatermarkFlexCounterTableKey(string key)
2746{
2747 return string(PG_WATERMARK_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP) + ":" + key;
2748}
2749
2750string PortsOrch::getPriorityGroupDropPacketsFlexCounterTableKey(string key)
2751{
2752 return string(PG_DROP_STAT_COUNTER_FLEX_COUNTER_GROUP) + ":" + key;
2753}
2754
2755bool PortsOrch::initPort(const string &alias, const string &role, const int index, const set<int> &lane_set)
2756{
2757 SWSS_LOG_ENTER();
2758
2759 /* Determine if the lane combination exists in switch */
2760 if (m_portListLaneMap.find(lane_set) != m_portListLaneMap.end())
2761 {
2762 sai_object_id_t id = m_portListLaneMap[lane_set];
2763
2764 /* Determine if the port has already been initialized before */
2765 if (m_portList.find(alias) != m_portList.end() && m_portList[alias].m_port_id == id)
2766 {
2767 SWSS_LOG_DEBUG("Port has already been initialized before alias:%s", alias.c_str());
2768 }
2769 else
2770 {
2771 Port p(alias, Port::PHY);
2772
2773 p.m_index = index;
2774 p.m_port_id = id;
2775
